what: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
title: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
text: nycOpenData provides simple, reproducible access datasets theNYC Open Data platform — directly R, API keys manual downloads required. Version 0.1.4 now includes wrappers 30+ NYC Open Data APIs, covering: 311 Service Requests -Hire Vehicles (FHV) Juvenile Justice (rearrest rates + caseloads) School Discharge Reporting Violent & Disruptive School Incidents Detention Admissions Borough/Community District Reports Street Tree Census Urban Park Ranger Animal Condition Responses Permitted Events (Historical) functions return clean tibble outputs support filtering viafilters = list(field = "value").

title: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
code: install.packages("nycOpenData")

title: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
code: devtools::install_github("martinezc1/nycOpenData")

title: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
text: nycOpenData makes New York City’s civic datasets accessible students, educators, analysts, researchers unified user-friendly R interface. Developed support reproducible research, open-data literacy, real-world analysis.

title: Convenient Access to NYC Open Data API Endpoints
text: Christian . Martinezc.martinez0@outlook.com GitHub: https://github.com/martinezc1 Developed part ofPSYC 7750G – Reproducible Psychological Research Brooklyn College, City University New York

Establishments uniquely identified CAMIS (record ID) number. Keep mind thousands restaurants start business go business every year; restaurants active status included dataset. Records also included restaurant applied permit yet inspected inspections resulting violations. Establishments inspection date 1/1/1900 new establishments yet received inspection. Restaurants received violations represented single row coded violations using ACTION field. dataset compiled several large administrative data systems, contains illogical values result data entry transfer errors. Data may also missing. dataset information Health Department’s Restaurant Grading website come data source. Health Department’s Restaurant Grading website : http://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/services/restaurant-grades.page See data dictionary file Attachments section OpenData website summary data fields allowable values.
